Reviews.Title: “One Night; Good stay”
Reviews.Author: mpmilestogo
Reviews.Content: I was returning from a week-long stay in India and wanted a place that would provide decent value, good prices, and had an interestikng location. The Gateway was all of those. There is also a really good BBQ place a short walk if you are into American BBQ with good cold beer choices. Check out http://www.smokeysbbq.com.sg/ for some great BBQ choices and its about .5 miles from the hotel. I only stayed one night but I enjoyed the neighborhood, walking around, and decent hotel conditions. The hotel is busy, bright, and has lots of people coming and going. I recommended the Gateway to another traveler looking for reasonable accommodations close to the Changi Airport as well.

Reviews.Title: “a little noisy but clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Sissiwei
Reviews.Content: this hotel could be a good value for money. Rooms are basic and small but they are OK.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect to get any sleep”
Reviews.Author: touristo53
Reviews.Content: too noisy, inconsiderate clients. Doors banging, calling out to each other fromroom to room or down the hall at all times of the day and night. Have stayed twice and the same problem each time so i will not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap accommodation”
Reviews.Author: sandygmaharaj
Reviews.Content: Considering the rates of hotels in Singapore, this was a good value for money. Room was spacious. Though there was no window (it seems to be a problem with most hotels in Singapore). They do not serve breakfast and charge for internet access. My UMTS dongle did not work as my room was to the interior of the hotel. Being a vegetarian, I did not get too many options near the hotel for food. Hotel is a bit far from the center of the city. Getting to (Paya Lebar) MRT station would take around 10 min walk or around 5 SGD in a taxi. Overall worth staying if the duration of stay is not too long.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean accommodation”
Reviews.Author: BruceMichael98
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in September 2010. Good clean room, good location with loads of nearby good eateries. Cheapish although surcharges for 'event weekends' like formula 1 and $10 per hour for late checkouts with the only exception being if you check in after 3 am. Rooms basic, bathrooms small but OK. Air conditioning, limited cable TV service. Internet at a price

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Blackpool-Jen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was apparently located on the edge of a 'red light' district of Singapore but we didn't see anything unsavoury. We had booked a deluxe room but were given a small window-less one. The reception staff apologised and gave us the key to a better room which had a window overlooking a small green at the rear of the hotel. The room was okay if a little dated. The bedding was clean but the bathroom had a lot of mould on the tiles although the actual toilet, bath and basin were clean. There was a hot water shower over the bath. We were only there for three days so it was adequate for our needs. There is a 7/11 next door and a big supermarket across the road. The hotel is situated near both Paya Lebar and Eunos MRT stations. We walked the other way along Joo Chat road to the waterfront, which was lovely. If you are on a budget and want a simple, clean hotel in a handy location, then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: backpacker2107
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in this hotel a few weeks ago. First it was dificult to find, but it is close to MRT praya lebar and next to 7-eleven. And near Mrt you have a MCDonalds. Reception staff is Ok, clean hotel,1SGD for public internet use,Left bagage near reception, room is ok, small,bathroom is small but ok, ONLY showcurtain needs Bleech!!!!!!! you can order MC Donalds in your room a whole meal for 10SGD. You can call Collect Call from your room, tv channels are ok. all rooms are non smoking. you can make booking online, and don`t give a copy of your credit card!!!!! they ask SDG 20 deposit, but when you don`t have it,,,,no worries! It`s a good place to stay in Singapore, but not for a whole week or so...just a few days must be ok.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Zakuii
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during the F1 Racing. Due to this, prices went up - but it was the best value and cheapest out of all the hotels during that peek period of time. Went to check in and staff needed a passport which I didn't have at that time, but they said that it was okay and let me check in anyways! Which was good. We had a room with a window and a 'non smoking' room. But when you walk in you can see an ashtray on the table. So much for 'non smoking' room. The room smelt funny upon walking in and we would have not put up with it if it had not been for the A/C that got rid of the smell. A/C was a bit noisy but didn't bother us too much and it did its job which is to make the room cold. The bed was good, allowed a good nights sleep. Bathroom was alright - staff supplied new towels and other bathroom amenities everyday as well as making up the bed. There is a 7/11 right next door which you can get snacks and drinks. MRT is about 10 mins walk not far at all! Taxi to the MRT is about $5SG. Didn't interact with the staff too much, but they reminded us that our check out time was approaching, and the fact they let me check in without a passport made them friendly. All in all, it's a clean and adequate hotel for a few nights stay. And if you're not fussy then it should be good, if you are then go to orchard hotel where it's insanely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: gwylow
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake this is not a luxury hotel by any means and is away from the 'heart' of the city, but what can you expect when paying $70 a night - if you want the red carpet treatment then pay Orchard Rd prices. That said, the hotel is more than adequate for a few days stay. The room was spacious and clean, as was the batchroom. There was no fridge (big deal!) but there was an ice machine in the corridor for drinks. The location is good, with MRT close by and plenty of local cafes/bars/hawker centres in the vicinity. The only oddity is the 2 level storage for cars, which is raised up & down hydraulically, so you need to keep pestering the reception staff whenever you wish to get to your car. That said, I found them pleasant to deal with and it was never an issue. Will definitely be staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Javacoffee
Reviews.Content: I hate crowing too much about the Gateway- I have been using it regularly since 2006. But- what other hotel can you get cable TV, inroom WIFI access and a decent sized room for S$78? Nowhere I reckon. Pluses include thevariety of food available on the street below- at night it is super colorful. Always though request a room facing Onan Street- especially if you are on a business trip with work the next day!

Reviews.Title: “At last! We found a decent, cheap, comfortable hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Subbi
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay: 14 May - 17 May 2009 Who: 52 year old "Mum" and 29 year old "Daughter" Reason for Stay: 3 days sightseeing in Singapore following 3 weeks in Viet Nam. We wanted a cheap, clean hotel that didn't rent rooms by the hour. We wanted to be near to public transport. Singapore is horrendously expensive for accommodation compared to other Asian countries, we wanted a hotel for less than SGD$100 per night. Very few reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor so we checked out 150 of the 300+ reviews on Asia Rooms before deciding to stay at the Gateway Hotel. Our Experience: Booked online via the Hotel's own website - by booking through their website, the room rate of SGD$128 per night was discounted to SGD$98 per night (Special Internet Rate). We had been looking at Hotel 81 Joo Chiat but this would have been SGD$30 more per night and while on the same road, further from public transport. We were required to complete and return a credit card authorisation (we scanned and emailed this) as the full price of the accommodation was charged on confirmation of booking. With the exchange rate at that time, for 3 nights accommodation we paid AUD$305.36 all up - room only, breakfast not available/included. We specifically requested, via email, that we be allocated a twin room with windows, and a non-smoking room. Research showed that some rooms in the hotel have no windows, and of course being in Asia smoking rooms are common. We arrived via Tiger Airways from Sai Gon (Ho Chi Minh City) just after 11:30am and took the Airport Shuttle at SGD$9 per head to the hotel, arriving a little before 1:30pm. The Shuttle drops you at the door of the hotel, though we now know given Joo Chiat and the Hotel's proximity to the airport we would have saved a few dollars by catching a taxi. Although we arrived prior to the designated check-in time we were able to check-in straight away. We were required to pay a refundable cash "deposit" of SGD$20 to cover potential incidentals (we already knew about this through our research). The lobby area was clean, and fairly spacious. There were a number of computers (coin operated) available for use by Hotel guests, and a few chairs for waiting in the lobby. Two lifts serviced the hotel - the lobby area and lifts are non-smoking due to laws passed in Singapore (there was signage in the lifts regarding the fines if caught smoking in the lobby/lifts). Given our swipe card key for our room, and pointed to the lift. Up to our room on the 4th floor. Wound our way down a couple of corridors to our room at the back of the hotel (probably about 40 - 50 paces from the lifts). Not only did we have a window - we had two! Each window in addition to curtains had shutters on the outside helping to keep out both light and sound. Clearly a non-smoking room. Our room was clean, neat, spacious, didn't smell. Two large single beds (wider than the 3 foot standard single bed here in Australia). Desk and chair, bench seat with drawers, tea & coffee making facilities, 2 complimentary bottles of water (we received another two each day of our stay), in room safe (inside the wardrobe). The television was bolted to the roof, making for extra space in an already large room. There was no fridge in the room (which we knew from the Hotel's website - there are fridges in the Theme Rooms however these come in Double format only) however there was an ice-bucket in the room and an ice machine 16 paces from our door. In addition there is a 7-11 store (open 24hours) immediately next door to the Hotel's entrance. Bathroom was small but clean overall. Our only complaint would be the mould on the shower curtain and tiles. While normally this doesn't concern us too much, unfortunately when the hot water hit the shower curtain you could smell the mould. That said, as we were only staying 3 nights we didn't worry about mentioning this to the Hotel, and are confident that if we had, they would have fixed it (a little bleach was all that was needed). The bathtub itself was clean - no mould. Toilet and vanity were pristine. We were provided with soap, two tooth brushes, and there was a dispenser on the wall presumably for shampoo/liquid soap but we had our own shampoo so didn't even look to see if it was full. The staff at the Hotel's desk generally took no notice of us as we came and left during our three days (which pleased us as we generally don't feel the need to share our day with reception), but some may find this distant/cold/unfriendly. When we did approach the desk (once to arrange late check out, once as our key had stopped working, and on check out) the staff were generally polite. There were usually two to three people on reception. When we left our room on the last day we had to navigate around the cleaning trolley - the ladies were lovely, moving so we could get past, and relatively friendly. We arranged to check out at 1pm instead of the standard 12pm at a cost of SGD$10 as our flight back to Perth did not leave until 3:50pm so we didn't need to be at the airport until 1:50pm. Wireless internet is available in the Hotel at a price. Having come from Viet Nam where generally internet was provided free of charge this was not an option we were interested in. The price was not overly cheap and you had to pay for a minimum of 2 hours without calculation based on actual usage (if you bought it at 1pm, it was gone by 3pm even if you only needed it for 10 minutes). The location: The Gateway Hotel is in Joo Chiat - the Malay quarter of Singapore, and is a 10 minute train ride from City Hall Interchange Station (to Paya Lebar MRT Station). The walk from the Gateway Hotel to the MRT Station would take roughly 10 minutes at a comfortable pace (unless of course you catch every red pedestrian light at the intersections). In addition to the train, public buses were readily available on Changi Road (we caught Bus 7 directly to the Botanic Gardens for just SGD$1.50 - double decker bus, trip took perhaps an hour through traffic). Much has been said about Joo Chiat and Geylang being in the red-light district of Singapore. We returned to our hotel after 8pm each night, and as late as 9:30+ and not once did we see any "ladies of the night". We did see lots of people out enjoying the fantastic Hawker food at one of the many Hawker centres near our hotel, including Mr Teh Tarik (very popular - great Murtabak available here), and Haig Road Hawker Centre to name but two. There were a number of small bars and Hawker centres/restaurants near our hotel however nothing to stop a sound night's sleep. At no time did we feel unsafe or frightened coming or going to/from our Hotel. In addition, there are some lovely sights nearby - beautifully restored shop houses, a few temples etc. Summary: When we next travel to Singapore we would definitely stay at the Gateway Hotel again. The price and location were perfect for our needs - particularly as Singapore has such a great public transport system which means there is no need to stay right in the "city centre". The room was clean and comfortable - the beds were very comfortable (not too hard or too soft, and we have experienced both extremes through Asia). The only downside was the mould on the bottom of the shower curtain (it was certainly not all over it) and that is an easy fix!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, not enough teabags”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterTennisstar
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in one of the larger "theme" rooms at the Gateway in February. It was spacious and clean and was well equipped with tv, safe, airconditioning, tea and coffee making facilities and plenty of extras in the bathroom including a new toothbrush everyday. However,on asking for an extra teabag at reception as we had managed to use the two provided that day we were told that we had already received our quota for the day! It was fairly noisy outside at night as there is a nightclub just across the road and also a bar/cafe and both of these places are open into the early hours of the morning. However, considering the price and accommodation provided, we thought it was fairly reasonable. Although there are numerous eating places within walking distance, if you are looking for anything resembling an English breakfast this could be a problem. The closest we could find was a version of toast and eggs which consists of 2 slices of sweet bread buttered then toasted with the buttered sides together. The eggs were boiled and very underdone and then shelled and served in a bowl- the sight of them put me off eggs for a while. However, 2 of these breakfasts served with 2 cups of tea which is made with condensed milk will only cost you about £3.50. This hotel is very near the Malay Village and although some of the area is fairly run down it seems to be an area used by locals rather than tourists so you can eat very cheaply.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate & clean”
Reviews.Author: jazzforever
Reviews.Content: This is an adequate place to stay in Singapore if you are on a budget and are willing to forego some comfort. This is Singapore after all, and comfort comes with a high premium here! Having said that, I found the rooms to be clean & spacious enough for a single traveller. A TV, in-room safe & wi-fi were available. I had a room with a window facing a residential area at the back of the hotel, which was nice & quiet. Only down side is the rather hard bed! The 7-11 next door and the ice machine in the corridor were very convenient (although a fridge in the room would have been better!). Reception staff were polite & helpful. Surprised to find Vietnamese food at the coffee shop across the road - try their beef pho, not bad! Although still within the red light district, I did not feel unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: kalyan3
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two days and one night at the Gateway Hotel. I think that the Gateway is fine for the price -- I think I spent $34/night for my room. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. My room was clean and big enough for a single occupant. I wasn't a big fan of the tv being bolted into a frame hanging from the ceiling, but really ... who cares that much about where the tv is (at least for a hotel in this price range)? The hotel had (pay-to-use) wi-fi in the rooms, and internet terminals in the lobby. The biggest downside: the location. It's close enough to Changi International Airport, but it's rather far from the action of central Singapore. It's not that far from the closest MRT (metro station), but you certainly don't feel like you're in the heart of Singapore. If you want to be about S$12-14 from the airport by taxi and you're looking for a place that's less than $50 bucks per night, you might want to consider Gateway. Don't stay here if you want to be near the tourist attractions of Orchard Road, Little India, or the CBD (Central Business District).

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one or two nights”
Reviews.Author: Noonehasthisname
Reviews.Content: I flew into Singapore and wanted a hotel close to the airport for an early flight the next day so I didn't want to spend a lot of cash on somewhere I'd spend hardly any time. Gateway fitted the bill exactly. I would say it's a cheap and cheerful hotel. The place looks like it good do with a lick of paint and a good clean but you get what you pay for. In my case £17.00 for bed and breakfast. Room size was okay, bathroom smelt of sour milk. Staff were friendly and helpful. Plenty of cheap quality eats in the road and several bars but no noise heard at night. If you are on a tight budget then this will suffice but I don't think it's suitable for families.

HotelInfo.Name: Gateway Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 60 Joo Chiat Road, Singapore 427726, Singapore
